QuestionStatement: In an economy with lump-sum taxes and no international sector, assume that the aggregate supply curve is horizontal.  If the marginal propensity to consume is equal to 0.8, which of the following will necessarily be true?
AnswerChoices: The average propensity to consume will be less than the marginal propensity to consume
The government expenditure multiplier will be equal to 5
A $10 increase in consumption spending will bring about an $80 increase in disposable income
Wealth will tend to accumulate in the hands of a few people
The economy will be running a deficit, since consumption expenditures exceed personal saving

QuestionStatement: In an economy with a horizontal aggregate supply curve, an increase in government spending will cause output and the price level to change in which of the following ways?
The aggregate demand curve is downward sloping because as the price level increases
AnswerChoices: Demand for interest sensitive expenditures increases
Demand for domestically produced substitute goods increases
Real value of fixed assets increases

QuestionStatement: According to Keynesian analysis, if government expenditures and taxes are increased by the same amount, which of the following will occur?
Which of the following events will most likely cause an increase in both the price level and real gross domestic product?
If an economy’s aggregate supply curve is upward sloping, an increase in government spending will most likely result in a decrease in the
An increase in which of the following will lead to lower inflation and lower unemployment?
AnswerChoices: The international value of domestic currency

QuestionStatement: An unanticipated decrease in aggregate demand when the economy is in equilibrium will result in
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the natural rate of unemployment
An increase in the rate of inflation
